page.title: 06The Ecology of Heybridge
page.content:
The fauna
A walk around the area reveals a wide range of fauna. In a single visit to the{canal}we were able to identify many and varied species. Using home-made nets of our mother's tights we caught the following:- *water boatmen *water beetles *water snails *freshwater prawns *leeches *tadpoles and various other mini-beasts. Frogs can be seen and we saw many eel nets which are left out over night at certain times of the year to catch the eels and elvers as they move up and down the canal. They are then fried and are a local{custom}and delicacy. Many anglers use the canal for{recreation}and fish for gudgeon, minnows, sticklebacks, roach, rudd, tench and the occasional carp.
